Subject: Lousy
Body: After paying for a subscription and restarting the app it will not allow me access unless I pay for the subscription again. Looking for more freedom to just write don’t purchase the subscription. Once purchased even when it did not work and canceled within the first day purchase they will not refund your money. Waste of money, now I have a subscription for a year that the app will not allow me to use.

Subject: It’s a great app. But there are few things

The only problem I have with this app is the amount of money I have to pay to get premium. $4 a month doesn’t sound like much, but when it all adds together that’s like 50 dollars a year! So no thanks but I do appreciate this app dearly. I hope you have a good day stranger, and please remember to keep smiling. There’s to much sadness in the world and you are WAY to beautiful to be crying. 💚

Author: FortniteGamerXDFaZe69420
Subject: Really good idea for an app
Body:
I think Reflectly is a really good app. I think it was a great idea executed in an almost perfect way. 

It’s smooth, easy to write check ins, and I almost feel like there’s someone who actually cares about me and is asking how I feel every day. I’m not one to write in diaries so I definitely haven’t been using this app to it’s full potential but I love it. 

My only problem is that there is no stat check up system in the free version, and the premium is very expensive. I don’t know what the premium includes so maybe it is worth $80 a year but I would like even just simple statistics for free users. 
Anyway, highly recommend downloading it, I love it.

Author: Hello, Humanoids!
Subject: Wishing for more free features
Body: This app overall is good, and seems to be a good way to remind oneself to be more conscious of one’s thoughts and moods. The free features however, are quite limited. The app’s namesake reflections are only available to those willing to pay for the premium version. I do not count myself among those people, and suggest that the app turn its attention to its casual users. In fairness, though, the available features, like mood check-ins and inspirational quotes, do seem to be enlightening.

Subject: Love this app

Would absolutely recommend this app!

Author: An Upset Teenage Girl
Subject: Love the concept!
Body: I am obsessed with the whole idea of this app. I just got it and I think I will be using it every day but there are a few things I would really love to see incorporated in the future. It would be nice if we could be a time on the photos other than it just going on the timeline. I took senior pics on one day and got them back later and I just wanted them to be in the same place if you know what I mean. Also, I would really like to see quotes other than just the “inspirational” category. For example, I think a lot of people would be interested in love/relationship, sad/breakup, and happy quotes, more like the vsco feel. Thanks for reading and I hope this helped! (:

Subject: My experience

Author: Missylou76
Subject: Read This
Body:
People have been concerned with the privacy policy and the fact that the app knows your name and address. I honestly don’t think there is anything to worry try about because I have had the app for a little more than two years now and nothing bad has happened. And I haven’t been hacked either.

I love this app for two main reasons. It allows you to sign out to keep everything private. And it allows you to express feelings and cope with anxiety and depression. I had really bad depression. And when quarantine came around, things just got worse. But when I downloaded Reflectly, I was able to talk about how I was feeling without anyone actually being there.

I have a ton of personal issues and a main one is the lack in the ability to express and share how I am feeling. This app lets you do that and more. It lets you say exactly how you’re feeling then it lets you say why you’re feeling that way, then I lets you title and save that as a journal update. And if just expressing feelings and emotions I ain’t enough, it also allowed you to add on with whatever you want to add. You can tell what happened that day. There’s no word limit so it’s easy to a lot off of your chest.

This app however does have its rough patches. Whenever you sign out, it save all of your progress, but it doesn’t save the settings changes. So if you have it in dark mode, when you sign out and then back in again it will be back in the default light mode. And the premium. The premium is how the app creators make their money. Yes it is a little limiting as to what you can and cannot do but I feel as if I can get plenty done even with the premium. The premium locks the extra stuff that you can do on the app. So if you feel angry because you think you’re not getting all of the app, you’re just wanting extra stuff when really all you need is the plain app it’s self.

Whenever the premium screen comes up it can be pretty confusing as to where the x is to get out of it. Just scroll down and you’ll see a No Thanks. Press that and it’ll take you out of the premium page.

I hope this review helped you. It’s the second one I’ve written actually. I don’t usually write more than one review but I thought this one would be helpful.

Subject: Great!!
Body: I have just gotten this app tonight, so far it is very helpful and working great. I get notified quotes (amount of my choice and period of time), which really boosts my confidence and does help a bit with my anxiety. You can schedule things on this to help become more organized. Organization is good for your mental health. The only complaint I have with the app is, I get notifications on my gmail app. I would appreciate if my quotes got notified on the app itself. I love the quotes, but my Gmail inbox will be quite full, due to the 20 quotes per day that I set in the app. I know it is difficult and takes long to code these types of things into the app, but please take this into consideration for me and the customers well being. I am not demanding, but I think that it would improve the app!   :)

Author: Rosa4141987
Subject: BUYER BEWARE. Stole my money. Support unavailable
Body: BUYER BEWARE !! I downloaded this app and the features seemed great, however, everything went very wrong when I purchased it. First of all, it charged me $60 for a year during the Black Friday sale, when it was only supposed to be $17. Next, none of the features were unlocked for me when I purchased the app i.e. it continued to ask me to purchase the app even after I did, and I wasn’t able to use any of the features I purchased. Lastly, I tried to contact support, which was a total joke. It directs you to contact support via Facebook messenger and when I did, I received no response. That’s right, there was zero response from the support team. So, now I’m out 60 bucks, can’t use the app, and support is virtually nonexistent. To say I’m extremely dissatisfied is to put it lightly. I regret ever downloading this app. I would highly recommend that anyone who chooses this app DOES NOT PURCHASE IT.  This is a SCAM. BUYER BEWARE!

Appen är jättebra, man får motivation o h blir positivt inställd på en dag! Subject: Subscription overcharge
Body:
A few things:

Email Verification leads to invalid link.

App does not update once Premium is purchased.

This is disrespectful and dishonest.

Author: kittyplays65
Subject: Wonderfull Stress Relief!
Body: Hi! I want to start out by saying I love this app! It’s a wonderful part of my nighttime routine that I always look forward to! As a person who is known for worrying, this app is amazing with its quotes, and being able to share how you are feeling, and what made you feel that way. You probably are thinking, “If they like the app so much, why five stars instead of four?” Well, there is one thing. Some features like viewing average mood, more quotes, and some daily motivation can only be used if you by premium. I think that at least some of the stuff should be free. Granted, I honestly forgot the price of it and I don’t have it, but I think a few of the features should be free, or maybe a lower cost. But overall, I love this app!!

Author: ryuzakiconverse
Subject: Therapeutic
Body:
This app is something I’ve needed for a while now. I’m still using the free trial and I’ve already decided the I’ll pay for the service when it’s over. In this day and age I, like the rest of y’all, are too caught up in everything.  We don’t take the time to stop and reflect on us. This is app challenges me and helps with my mental well-being. I tend to take most thing for granted. The best part of it all it’s saved so I can reflect on it later. It’s a journal with prompts, which makes journaling easier. I don’t have to worry about the surface level reflections. But the things that makes life meaningful. 
So all I have to say is....thank you!

Author: olivia-maree
Subject: I love it, but there’s one thing I’d like added :)
Body:
I really like this app! It’s made me feel good tracking my progress and it feels like even though it’s just an app, someone actually cares to check up on me. 

But I was just wondering if you’d be able to add more options where you select the activities that have made you feel good/bad that day. There’s only 10, and majority of the time none of those things impact me much. But I have to click something, otherwise it won’t let me complete it and move onto the next step. May I suggest something like involving just that person emotions and brain? Instead of it just being things like “school, family, food, health, work, friends, relationships, etc.”. I just feel like a lot of people rely on themselves for happiness, or they make themselves feel upset or angry. This is just what I think; but it would be good if you have more options to why we are feeling the way we are. 

But overall, I quite enjoy this app and I’m thankful to the creators. Definitely recommend :)

Author: combooter
Subject: I like it a lot. Could be better though
Body:
I like it since I journal in a book and I can write in the app to have an idea of what to write in the book. I like the previous writing template because 
1. I could chose a picture for each day. Currently, you have to do it during that day so if you have a picture that fits something from a few days ago, it’s gonna show up on today.
2. It used to ask me a question like “who’s one person you look up to” or something like that. I liked it because it would make me think more than what happened today. If I want that again, I’m gonna have to pay money for it.

Besides that, it’s a pretty good app

Author: jellybean0721
Subject: 5 stars if it worked properly
Body:
I love the look, feel, and idea of this app. I am using the free trial for the premium to see if I like the premium before paying for it but the app does won’t let me try any of the premium features. It keeps telling me that I need to unlock the premium but when I try it won’t let me because I’ve already done it. I have a feeling the app would be worth 5 stars if I could use it as intended. Also have to take a star off for customer service. I tried to find somewhere to speak with someone about it and all I could find was messaging on Facebook Messenger that looked like it was an automated chat that wouldn’t even respond to me.

Update on review: Someone got back to me and was able to assist me. I have access to my premium now and am excited to see how the app helps!

Author: sooooddddaaaapppooooopppppppp
Subject: I’m disappointed.
Body: It’s an app for mental health. We shouldn’t need to pay to get stats or daily check ins. It’s so frustrating. I understand they need to make money but do so in a different way. I was excited to get my stats today just to see I need premium for them. I’m young and can’t pay for a stupid premium on a MENTAL HEALTH app. Some younger ppl use this because we can’t see a therapist or something and we can’t even get updated on our own health from a highly rated app. It’s extremely frustrating and I won’t be keeping this app. Mental health is more important than your company making money. Get over yourself and let us keep track of ourselves and get quote on quote “38% happier” which is probably a lie. So without premium the app is pointless. Thanks for nothing.

Author: Dannyhealyonline
Subject: Dumb and ethically questionable app
Body:
Not only a dump diary app but an ethically questionable one. 

Regarding the ethics.  On sign up it takes you to a payment page which looks like can’t be avoided if you want to use the app.  Then, top right hand corner is an Incredibly faint X .   Good luck If your older or have poor vision.   Preying on the weak these guys are.

Regarding dumb.  The First step once you’ve accessed the interactive component of the application is to record how your feeling.   There are approx 10 icons which you’re supposed to mark as reasons for why you’re feeling like you are.   Non of them applied to me.   There was no none of the above option.

A nice looking but remarkably dumb and unethical application.

Subject: Love this app but.....

I may have considered it if it were a one time thing but that’s a lot of money to spend on an app when I can get a regular journal and do almost the exact same thing, although it’s not as portable, for like $5.00. I get that you have to do that to keep the app add free, but I would rather experience the full app with a couple adds rather than not getting the whole experience. I got this app because of all the features that were advertised but I can’t access them all. Hopefully that will change sometime soon.

Author: SkyTheUltimate
Subject: I like it, but it could be better
Body:
I love the way the app works. You can write as little or as many things in your entry as you want.
This is great for those who can’t put their own thoughts together on a bad day.

I do think their should be a few more options for the mood check/ins. The moods should have two more Ex: meh, and kinda good. And the reasons page should have a few more options, including “other”.

I would also recommend adding at least one more specification, or give the option to.

That’s all I’ve got to say. I love the app, and I’m interested to see features that may be added in the future!

Body: I was scrolling on Instagram and saw an ad for this app thinking it was the best thing that has ever happened to me. Because I’m a teenager constantly struggling to deal with the world we live  in and I’m dealing with depression so this app looked great. When I downloaded it I was so excited but when I saw that I would have to pay money for it that made me mad. An app that supposed to help with mental health should not cost $60 a year to use. Something like this needs to be free. I personally think it’s sick to make an app so perfect and so helpful for the ones in need and yet make it cost money. I can’t afford things like this as a teenager. This is sick and needs to fixed.

Author: NothinTooBig
Subject: Psychological Backing
Body: This app allows the user to document their emotions and daily events. The mindfulness that’s promoted through daily journaling while focusing on and encouraging users to becoming happier everyday, makes it easier to see patterns in thoughts and behaviors interfering with this goal. This reinforced paradigm shift actually starts to shift the users mindset and allows the self assessment of mood and events to become more positive. It also bridges the time between therapy appointments for patients and creates a log for events or emotional states that can be discussed at a later time. The encouraging daily quotes and relaxing or pleasing images is positive reinforcement of the goal to become happier.

Author: EPArrow
Subject: Great concept, poor execution.
Body:
I downloaded this app because I love the idea of journaling and reflecting for the sake of bettering my own (and others) mental health, as well as for an assignment in my Abnormal Psychology course at my university. When I first started it, the user interface was very easy to understand and very aesthetically pleasing. Although I became very disappointed to find that almost every main feature of the app can’t be accessed without a monthly subscription. At first glance, it doesn’t seem like it has many restricted features. As I used it more and gained “access” to my stats, I was sorely disappointed that I can’t even look at the trends of my moods and feelings throughout the time using the app without paying money. I think this app has a lot of potential and is a great concept but if you’re looking for a way to reflect and evaluate your own mood, I suggest buying a cheap notebook from the store and writing in it and looking back at what you wrote after a specified amount of time rather than paying a monthly subscription for essentially the same function, but with more statistics and numbers. Or even better, you might as well go and get a real therapist for the kind of money they’re asking for. 300 dollars for a lifetime subscription is ridiculous for something that offers so little, with no human communication or contact. 

What this app does do good with: I do appreciate the motivational quotes that you can endlessly scroll through, but this is not a selling point for the app whatsoever. Additionally, I think the main feature (mood check in) is very good. The mood check ins are a great starting point for reflection on mental health as reflection and self-awareness are typically key-roles when trying to identify things like mood disorders and worries. This app also does a fantastic job of monetizing people’s mental health, specifically their poor mental health, which can be seen as a good and a bad thing depending on who you are. 

Overall, my search for a quality mood reflection and journaling app does not end here. I would say this app could be so much greater and much more versatile if the only free function available wasn’t “what’s your mood today?”. I don’t believe that is a truly efficient way to help a person or yourself when there are tons of better and cheaper ways to go towards that’ll be more beneficial in both the short and long term. Also, At the end of the day, nothing beats human connection when it comes to improving and reflecting on your day and how you feel.

Author: broadway baby🙈
Subject: absolutely amazing!!!
Body:
i’m not one to write these long reviews, so reflectly, you should know you’re something special.

i got this app a few days ago and i’m already hooked. so far, it’s done so much better than any other diary apps to keep me consistently checking in on my moods. it’s also super beneficial because it helps me keep track of what makes me happy, and what brings me down.

the statistics, quotes, and other additional features are also super helpful. it’s not pressurizing and doesn’t send you annoying notifications every second to come check in.

i also purchased the premium version. i really like it because the reflections help me look back on my life and get a better perspective on things.

all in all, it’s just a great app, and i can’t wait to see more! 100% recommend it to anyone. 💕

Author: Maeghan G.
Subject: Easy to use even when your motivation is at its lowest.
Body:
The app is very easy to navigate and has a soothing, calm appearance to it. I love how you can make it your own, but also that it’s organized and structured enough to guide you through without feeling the need to write an essay every day. It’s super helpful to be able to track your moods because it helps you identify triggers to negative emotions and thoughts that you might never have noticed otherwise. I love the quotes and the calming art behind them too. When my depression is at its worst and I can’t get off of the couch or out of bed, it’s one thing I can do to motivate me to take that next step forward. Great app all around!

Update - I’ve read some reviews where people are complaining about the price. While I totally understand, you need to remember that it costs a lot of money to develop, update, and just run an app. The people who are working every day to keep the app the best it can be (and who developed it in the first place) need money too! The fact that they’ve avoided needing ads to fund the app for so long tells you all you need to know about how much they care for their consumers. If you don’t have insurance, it can cost $75 just to see a counselor for one appointment. While this isn’t the same as having a counselor, it provides an invaluable amount of mental health benefits in a setting that’s totally personal, private, and incredibly convenient. I can’t call my counselor during my 30 minute lunch break in a 10 hour work day, but I can certainly write a quick entry about how stressed I am, and read quotes that motivate me to keep pushing and stay positive! Simply put, I think it’s kind of unrealistic/unfair to complain about a price that’s honestly very reasonable for all the app has to offer. Ads are my biggest app turn-off all around, so kudos to the Reflectly team for doing the best they can to put food on their own tables and help thousands of people stay alive and stay well at the same time!

Author: Kimukun
Subject: I really enjoy this app, but there is a catch
Body: I really enjoy the fact that they are making an app with people’s well being in mind, and I really enjoy being able to put my feelings down somewhere where I won’t be judged. I just don’t enjoy the aspect that you need to pay to unlock everything, especially when it’s something where you are looking to it for comfort. I hate subscriptions and the only option to pay for the ‘full’ version of this app is the lifetime purchase, which is $300. I understand people gotta get payed at the end of the day, but this shouldn’t be one of the things those people are looking towards to make money from, especially when they are trying to promote the app as a safe space. Everything aside from this though is very well done, I enjoy how the app looks and works.

Subject: Would be 5 stars and here’s why. Overall would recommend.
Body: Reflectly is great! I love the inspirational quotes every morning but I really wish I didn’t have to pay monthly for it! I don’t exactly have the money to do so but I’d love to use the features! I think it’s a great app but it was nice to do the daily reflection and not have to pay for it, but when they removed that and added it to the premium features it kinda made me lose interest in the app, I used to use it daily until they made almost everything a membership only feature, but if you have an extra $20 to spend every year then go for it! The only features you’ll have with the free version is the ability to do a mood check-in, add photos (which I haven’t done yet) and see the inspirational quotes.

Body: This is a great way for me to journal without needing to bring a physical copy with me. It’s soothing and therapeutic and it’s nice it has the extra features that a journal can’t offer. The one thing I would ask for is to be able to add check ins after they’ve happened. For instance if I have a particularly anxious day/have a panic attack I may only remember to enter it in the next day

Author: stupid person is me
Subject: Please don’t waste your time
Body: I’m very young. Younger than you think but I have to say something. You shouldn’t have to charge people for them to tell you their problems. People have issues and feel like they can’t tell anyone else so they get apps like this to help them. But then they cost money. I understand that if you make an app you want money because you have your problems too, but couldn’t you just get that from adds? But not too many or you will probably get even worse reviews. Thank you for reading if you are reading this! :)

Author: Rhianna Rice
Subject: Recommend it
Body: I love this app because it makes me reflect on my emotions on the day and watch them progressively get better. The small reminders are great because it reminds me to get up and so some tasks if my day wasn’t good. But when I get to see my reflections from past days and see that I was happy, I can just look at the reasonings for it and do the same on bad days to lift my mood. I would’ve given it five stars but a lot of things are locked because I need premium. But the most important things are free and it helps me so much to keep in touch with my emotions.
